column4: Hi! Will someone help me with this problem: "scp <path>/<file>: Read-only filel system"? There is plenty of space, I do have permissions and the filesystem is reiserfs "rw". Any ideas? Thanks.
Hi! Will someone help me with this problem: "scp <path>/<file>: Read-only filel system"? There is plenty of space, I do have permissions and the filesystem is reiserfs "rw". Any ideas? Thanks.
your question is going to be easier to answer if you provide the exact and complete command you tried

scp file remote-host:
2007-01-13T14:49:00.000Z	mnoir		:)
2007-01-13T14:49:00.000Z	lgc	mnoir	scp file remote-host", I mean.
no I meant the exact, literal, cut and paste it command, not your impression of a generic syntax
scp madelung.c xitle.fciencias.unam.mx:~lgc which won't mean much to you, I gather. That's why I used "my impression of a generic syntax"

of course it means something to me.  it means that you have not provided a target file name.  I believe that scp requires a literal target file name. try "scp madelung.c user@xitle.fciencias.unam.mx:filename" replacing filename with a name of choice and uuser with your username.  I use scp often and do not find it as intelligent about filling in the assumptions like cp is :)
that's the default behaviour, but let me try it so...
hmm - did you get the password challenge?
you mean if I had to type the password? Yes.

ok i am puzzled - i assume you have write access to your home at  xitle.fciencias.unam.mx - maybe you need to talk to the admin there - does scp work for you on your localhost? it may sound pointless but is worth a try
I have root access to the remote machine (though I'm not the admin).
i need to feed sheep but i am interested in solution - can i pm you to give my email?
you want me to mail you the solution whenever we find out what is wrong?
